title: Invasion begins
caption: Before and after: On the left, smoke covers the presidential palace in Baghdad during the first U.S. invasion of Iraq. On the right, a night view of Baghdad's al-Fardous square in 2013. PATRICK BAZ/AFP/Getty Images
body: President George W. Bush announces that U.S. and Brit­ish troops have entered southern Iraq, followed by a wave of missiles aimed at government buildings in Baghdad. Among the first Mar­ines killed in com­bat — Lance Cor­por­al Jose Gu­ti­er­rez, 23, of Lo­mita.

title: Baghdad falls
caption: U.S. Marines place a chain the head of a statue of Saddam Hussein before pulling it down in Baghdad's al-Fardous square. RAMZI HAIDAR/AFP/Getty Images
body: Baghdad collapses to coalition forces. After Iraqis topple a statue of President Saddam Hussein, widespread looting, burning of buildings and vandalism of museums spread around the capital.

title: ‘Mission accomplished’
caption: A banner reads "Mission Accomplished" aboard the USS Lincoln where ex-president George W. Bush declared the war against terrorism had reached a turning point as the aircraft carrier sails towards Naval Air Station North Island, in San Diego, Calif.  STEPHEN JAFFE/AFP/Getty Images
body: President George W. Bush announce that U.S. forces had brought a "turning of the tide" against terrorism and the conflict in Iraq had reached a "new era."

title: Hussein captured
caption: A U.S. soldier from the 1st Brigade, 4th Infantry Division gets ready to enter the hole where toppled dictator Saddam Hussein was captured in Ad Dawr, near his home town of Tikrit. MAURICIO LIMA/AFP/Getty Images
body: Amer­ic­an troops find Saddam Hussein in a dirt hole near his hometown of Tikrit.

title: Abu Ghraib abuse revealed
body: 60 Minutes broadcast reveals Abu Ghraib prisonor human rights abuses to the nation, with graphic photos of evidence of the physical, sexual and psychological abuse of Iraqi prisoners by American military personnel.

title: Transition of power to interim Iraqi government
caption: Members of the new interim Iraqi Governing Council pose for a portrait following a meeting. MARWAN NAAMANI/AFP/Getty Images
body: The U.S. start to transition government power to Prime Min­is­ter Ay­ad Allawi, who will lead Iraq's interim government.

title: White House: No WMDs in Iraq
caption: President George W. Bush meets with commission members whose report found that U.S. intelligence agencies were wrong in most prewar assessments about weapons of mass destruction in Iraq. BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP/Getty Images
body: The White House ac­know­ledges U.S. forces have failed to find Iraq's weapons of mass destruction (WMD) program, which was cited as justification for going to war.

title: Iraq holds elections
caption: An Iraqi election officials fills in a registration receipt at the registration/polling station during the country's first multi-party election in over 50 years. JIM WATSON/AFP/Getty Images
body: Iraqis participate in their country's first multi-party elections in more than 50 years.

title: Hussein charged and tried for war crimes
caption: Saddam Hussein is charged with war crimes and will be in court. AFP/AFP/Getty Images
body: A spe­cial Ir­aqi tribunal begins a trial against the deposed Iraqi leader, Sadaam Hussein, for his alleged involvement in the killing of 150 Shiite villagers in Dujayl in 1982. The trial is televised in Iraq.

title: Hussein convicted
caption: Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein speaks at his hearing, where he was convicted for crimes against humanity during a special Iraqi tribunal. AFP/AFP/Getty Images
body: The Iraqi High Tribunal finds Hus­sein guilty of crimes against hu­man­ity and is sen­tenced to death by hanging.

title: Hussein executed
caption: Iraq's national television station, Al-Iraqia, airs the moments leading up to the execution of the former Iraqi dictator.  Al-iraqia/Getty Images
body: Sad­dam Hus­sein is hanged in Baghdad.

title: Troop surge
caption: Iraqi soldiers arrive in the city of Tikrit. TAUSEEF MUSTAFA/AFP/Getty Images
body: Pres­id­ent George W. Bush an­nounces a surge of 20,000 more American combat troops as part of the effort to curb sectarian violence.

title: Tours extended
caption: Secretary of Defense Robert Gates, left, and Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Peter Pace, right, answer questions about the surge strategy. Jamie Rose/Stringer
body: Tours for combat troops are extended for another 12- to 15-months.

title: U.S. and Iraq agree on withdrawal deadline
caption: Iraqi Parliament members from the Muqtada al-Sadr block, sit in a tent outside to protest the withdrawal agreement between the U.S. and Iraq. AFP/Getty Images
body: Ir­aq’s three-mem­ber Pres­id­ency Coun­cil ratifies the U.S.-Iraq Status of Forces Agreement, setting deadlines for the withdrawal of foreign combat troops from the country. The agreement mandated that most U.S. soldiers leave by June 30, 2009 and all U.S. forces exit the country entirely by Dec. 31, 2011.

title: U.S. starts transitioning military power to Iraqis
caption: An Iraqi soldier stands guard on a side street. Ahmad Al-Rubaye/Getty Images
body: Iraqi troops gain military control of the Green Zone, signalling the first step of the transition of power and America's withdrawal from the country.

title: Obama declares the Iraq war over
caption: Obama announced that all U.S. troops will leave Iraq by the end of the year. Win McNamee/Getty Images
body: President Barack Obama declares the war over, saying that the country needs to focus on its own problems.

title: Combat officially ends in Iraq
caption: A U.S. soldier walks down a path prior to the change of command ceremony in Baghdad on September 1, 2010, as a new US military mission in Iraq was launched, marking the end of seven years of combat. AHMAD AL-RUBAYE/AFP/Getty Images
body: The war officially ends as the last American fighting forces leave Iraq, eight years after the first troops arrived in the country.
